ssc_usart_example.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Example of an interrupt-driven SSC communication.

This file contains an example using the SSC module with interrupts.

It will display a string on the screen. Refer to the usart_options structure in main for configuration options for your terminal.

Please make sure that the correct jumper(s) is/are set on your development board. Refer to your hardware reference guide if necessary.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices with an INTC module can be used.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

#include "gpio.h"
#include "pm.h"
#include "intc.h"
#include "print_funcs.h"

Function Documentation

int main ( void   ) 

The main function.

It sets up the SSC module on EXAMPLE_SSC. The terminal settings are 57600 8N1. Then it sets up the interrupt handler and waits for a SSC interrupt to trigger.

00214 {
00215   // USART GPIO mapping.
00216   static const gpio_map_t USART_GPIO_MAP =
00217   {
00218     {EXAMPLE_USART_RX_PIN, EXAMPLE_USART_RX_FUNCTION},
00219     {EXAMPLE_USART_TX_PIN, EXAMPLE_USART_TX_FUNCTION}
00220   };
00221 
00222   // USART options.
00223   static const usart_options_t USART_OPTIONS =
00224   {
00225     .baudrate     = 57600,
00226     .charlength   = 8,
00227     .paritytype   = USART_NO_PARITY,
00228     .stopbits     = USART_1_STOPBIT,
00229     .channelmode  = USART_NORMAL_CHMODE
00230   };
00231 
00232   // SSC GPIO mapping.
00233   static const gpio_map_t SSC_GPIO_MAP =
00234   {
00235     {AVR32_SSC_RX_DATA_0_PIN, AVR32_SSC_RX_DATA_0_FUNCTION},
00236     {AVR32_SSC_TX_DATA_0_PIN, AVR32_SSC_TX_DATA_0_FUNCTION}
00237   };
00238 
00239   // Swith to external Oscillator 0.
00240   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00241   
00242   // Assign GPIO pins to USART.
00243   gpio_enable_module(USART_GPIO_MAP, sizeof(USART_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(USART_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00244 
00245   // Initialize USART in RS232 mode.
00246   usart_init_rs232(EXAMPLE_USART, &USART_OPTIONS, FOSC0);
00247 
00248   // Assign GPIO pins to SSC.
00249   gpio_enable_module(SSC_GPIO_MAP, sizeof(SSC_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(SSC_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00250   
00251   // Initializes SSC in USART mode. Note: we enable the loopback mode for the sake
00252   // of this example (the SSC receiver is programmed to receive transmissions from
00253   // the SSC transmitter).
00254   ssc_uart_init( ssc, 57600, SSC_UART_STOPBITS_ONE, SSC_UART_PARITY_MARK , 8,
00255                  SSC_UART_LOOPBACK_MODE_ENABLE, FOSC0);
00256 
00257   // Disable all interrupts.
00258   Disable_global_interrupt();
00259 
00260   // Initialize interrupt vectors.
00261   INTC_init_interrupts();
00262 
00263   // Register the SSC interrupt handler to the interrupt controller.
00264   INTC_register_interrupt(&ssc_int_handler, AVR32_SSC_IRQ, INT0);
00265   // Register the USART interrupt handler to the interrupt controller.
00266   INTC_register_interrupt(&usart_int_handler, EXAMPLE_USART_IRQ, INT1);
00267 
00268   // Enable SSC Rx interrupt.
00269   ssc->ier = (1<<AVR32_SSC_IER_RXRDY_OFFSET);
00270   // Enable USART Rx interrupt.
00271   EXAMPLE_USART->ier = AVR32_USART_IER_RXRDY_MASK;
00272   
00273   // Print a message to USART.
00274   print(EXAMPLE_USART, "\n\nType a character to use the interrupt handler.\n"
00275                        "It will be sent through SSC.\n"
00276                        "An interrupt occurs at the end of reception.\n\n" );
00277 
00278   // Enable all interrupts.
00279   Enable_global_interrupt();
00280 
00281   while(TRUE);
00282 }

static void ssc_int_handler ( void   )  [static]

The SSC interrupt handler.

Note:
The `__attribute__((__interrupt__))' (under GNU GCC for AVR32) and `__interrupt' (under IAR Embedded Workbench for Atmel AVR32) C function attributes are used to manage the `rete' instruction.

Definition at line 150 of file ssc_usart_example.c.

References EXAMPLE_USART, ssc, and ssc_uart_getchar().

Referenced by main().

00151 {
00152   int c;
00153 
00154   // In the code line below, the interrupt priority level does not need to be
00155   // explicitly masked as it is already because we are within the interrupt
00156   // handler.
00157   // The SSC Rx interrupt flag is cleared by side effect when reading the
00158   // received character.
00159   // Waiting until the interrupt has actually been cleared is here useless as
00160   // the call to print_char will take a very long time before the interrupt
00161   // handler is left and the interrupt priority level is unmasked by the CPU.
00162 
00163   // Get the received character on the SSC.
00164   c = ssc_uart_getchar(ssc);
00165   // Print a msg to USART.
00166   print(EXAMPLE_USART,"\n -- SSC Rx Interrupt -- ");
00167   print(EXAMPLE_USART,"\n Data received : ");
00168   // Print the received character to USART.
00169   print_char(EXAMPLE_USART, (c == '\r') ? '\n' : c);
00170 }
